channel.title: Posts on James Le Nguyen
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on James Le Nguyen

item.title: learning curve
item.description: Throughout the years, I’ve read blog post and articles about programming and having now personally experiencing it–there is definitely a learning curve but like with anything new you learn–it will be hard at first; move forward and you will be rewarded with new insight and knowledge. And more importantly if you have any self-doubt, find people who can support your learning endevors.(this applies to any subject)

item.title: Python is fun
item.description: In my younger days when I was playing around with the windows command prompt, I remember seeing python in the OS directory but never thought twice what it was or why it was installed—I just figured it was something that made Windows XP work. It’s not until now that I noticed everything connecting and the relation to things that I hadn’t notice before which feels both interesting and somewhat regreftul. Also, did I mention programming is hard.

item.title: A Hero's Journey
item.description: I’ll start this post with a generic but hopfully motivational quote: “Life is full of missed opportunities, especially if you don’t try, you’ll never know what thoes possibilities could be."—unknown I’ve been working full-time since the completion of my bachelor’s back in 2012 and its funny to think that the only thing I wanted then, was to work. Now, having worked for all these years—school wasn’t so bad (minus the lack of $).
